noun.description: An Indic language spoken in the northeastern Indian states of Bihar, Jharkhand, and West Bengal, one of the Bihari group of languages.
An ancient dialect of Prakrit formerly spoken in what is now the Bihar area.

origin: From Hindi Magadhī, from Magadha South Bihar<br>early 19th century; earliest use found in Asiatick Researches. From Sanskrit Māgadhī from Magadha South Bihar.
